POB-EYE Examples

Introduction

The POB-BOT is a complete robot built with a programmable color camera (the POB-EYE), a graphical black and white screen (POB-LCD), an Input/Output controller (POB-PROTO) and a caterpillar mobile tank.

  • POBEYE:

This is the brain of the robot, the POB-Eye is a color camera which allows you to do real time pattern recognition and brings the calculating power to the robot. The POB-Eye is the heart of POB-Technology's modular architecture.

  • POB-PROTO:

The POB-Proto is an analog and digital Input/Output module. With the joystick, you can pilot your robot or design a graphical user interface. The POB-Proto allows DC motors management as well as servomotors or any kind of I/O used for your own sensors and actuators.

Example's list:

  • A simpe hello world on UART: Hello World.
  • Another hello world on the LCD Screen: Hello world on LCD.
  • Ping pong between POBEYE and your computer with the UART: Ping Pong.
  • Grab a frame from camera and display it on the LCD: Camera.
  • Form recognition with the POB-EYE: Form recognition (example 1).
  • A second example of form recognition with LCD Screen: Form recognition (example 2)
  • How to initialize the POB-PROTO board: Init POB-PROTO.
  • Read the value of the joystick sensor: Use the joystick.
  • Move a servomotor with the joystick: Move a servomotor.
  • Move the POB-BOT with the joystick: Move the POB-BOT.

Source code location:

You can find POB-EYE source code and POB-TOOLS project file on your computer at this location:

C:/Program Files/POB-Technology/PobTools/sdk/pobeye/examples
